page.title: 07AGRICULTURE contd.
page.content: The most usual farm buildings to be found were a milking parlour, a cow house and a cubicle house. MILK COLLECTION Up to 5 years ago a lorry came round the farms collecting milk cans every morning. On handing over 2 full cans of milk to the milkman 2 empty cans would be given in exchange. Today, however a milk tanker comes daily to collect the milk is kept fresh and cool and is then taken into Harrogate. FISH FARMING The Glasshouses Fish Farm began in 1985:there are 260,000 fish in six tanks and a large canal in which to hold the fish that are ready to be sold. A similar farm at Low Laithe breeds their own fish and has one large tank in which there are about 130,000 fish.
